message:
Hi Geeks 
I need this answer ASAP please it is urgent, 
I want to create back-end service broadcast data in real time to number of user listens to it.
The back-end service also collect its  data from other servers in real time.
What is technology should i use to make data real time between my-service, front-end users and other servers which have data. 

after search i found that socket is good choice.
Is Socket will be valid in this scenario ? 
Is there any better protocol ?  
#Thanks

data.message:
Sockets is very low level you will need to deal with a lot of details you maybe don't need it
You can think of queue based message passing or may be more elegant puplish/subscribe techniques 
If you can describe it in more detail we  can then go more clear into a good fit solution
Amr Almgwary Do you mean Socket.io?

you need some implementation of publish/subscribe pattern .. some servers publishes and others listen, you can use any technology to implement that ... you can use real time database like firebase, or using sockets and back it up with something like redis pubsub, or you can use channels in asp signalR but you then going to implement some apis to be able to push data ... or you might some other online service ... if your app is all like this you might think about switching to event driven architecture
Also an open source alternative if you want to save some money http://rethinkdb.com
You want to implement a Pub/Sub system ?
Simplest way is to use a queue and subscribers, use rabbit mqs.

you can use web service like restful and retrieve your data by json or xml. 

about the language you can use c# or php or c++ all of them have the same concept with different syntax.
